title: Comp. func. def. by int. and comp. func.

content.question:
The functions f and g are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mtext> and </mtext> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5456@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(a) Find f'(x) and g'(x).

frqParts.text:
The functions f and g are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mtext> and </mtext> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5456@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(a) Find f'(x) and g'(x).
(b) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of y = g(x) at x = π.
(c) Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression that represents the maximum value of g on the interval 0 ≤ x ≤ π. Justify your answer.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
